metadata.title: CVE-2021-44730 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - high
metadata.description:
snapd 2.54.2 did not properly validate the location of the snap-confinebinary. A local attacker who can hardlink this binary to another locationto cause snap-confine to execute other arbitrary binaries and hence gainprivilege escalation. Fixed in snapd versions 2.54.3+18.04, 2.54.3+20.04and 2.54.3+21.10.1

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-44730` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

snap-confine - 2.54.3+20.04
snapd - 2.54.3+20.04
snapd-xdg-open - 2.54.3+20.04
ubuntu-core-launcher - 2.54.3+20.04
ubuntu-core-snapd-units - 2.54.3+20.04
ubuntu-snappy - 2.54.3+20.04
ubuntu-snappy-cli - 2.54.3+20.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: snapd package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.54.3+20.04').
